result.execSummary:
The defendant Letrell R Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to:  consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 156 days.

miscConds.notes: No controlled substances or alcohol.  No driving without a valid driver's license
AODA assessment; treatment, if needed. Urine screens.

Obtain high school diploma, HSED or GED.
Seek and maintain employment.
Be given job and vocational training.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms.

Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample if not previously provided.
Court advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

Pay the DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements by the end of probationary period.  Should defendant get revoked and be sent to prison, Court ordered monies taken by the Department of Correction from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance would be then be paid while on Extended Supervision.   Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Letrell R Williams

records.addlTxt: Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Letrell R Williams not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Branch 20 in trial.  Case is rescheduled; file retained in court.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Letrell R Williams not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Branch 20 in trial.  Case is adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Letrell R Williams not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a date for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Letrell R Williams not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested another scheduling date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Letrell R Williams in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Letrell R Williams in custody.  Ron Dague for Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Letrell R Williams in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Letrell R Williams in custody.  George David Kidd appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
